intro: Hieracium bohatschianum subsp. platytrigonodon, commonly known as the Bohatschian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained, nutrient-rich environments. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive shape and structure, and it produces achenes as its primary seed dispersal method. The subspecies is distinguished by its broader, more truncate leaf bases compared to other members of the species.
